thread.title: Portions of two south Lincoln streets to close for repairs
thread.title_full: Portions of two south Lincoln streets to close for repairs

author: @1011_news
title: Portions of two south Lincoln streets to close for repairs
text: Portions of two south Lincoln streets to close for repairs Published: Aug. 15, 2024 at 4:27 PM CDT|Updated: 4 hours ago LINCOLN, Neb. (KOLN) - Lincoln Transportation and Utilities announced Thursday that portions of two south Lincoln streets will temporarily close beginning Tuesday and Wednesday. The closures are as follows: - South 70th Street between Pine Lake and Yankee Hill roads will be closed beginning Tuesday for railroad track repair. This work is scheduled to be completed by next Friday. StarTran Route 40-Heart Hospital will be detoured during this closure. The recommended detour is Pine Lake to 56th or 84th streets to Yankee Hill Road. - Westbound Yankee Hill Road between 27th and 14th streets will be closed to through traffic beginning Wednesday for pavement repair. This work is scheduled to be completed by Aug. 25. Local westbound traffic will have access between 27th Street and Executive Woods Drive. StarTran Route 13-South 13th will be detoured during this closure. The recommended detour is 27th Street to Pine Lake Road. LTU recommends travelers to seek alternate routes during this time and to exercise caution around the closures.
